page.title: 04Barby\Education
page.content:
Barby Primary School was built some seventeen years ago. The school caters for children between the ages of four and eleven years after which they go to secondary school in Daventry. There are four classes of mixed ability children and approximately 100 children attend school. The school day begins at 9.00 a.m. and ends at 3.45 p.m. There is a lunch break of one and a quarter hours. A meal is served at mid-day at a cost of 55p although in cases of hardship this fee is waived.
The school has a library, a television,a radio and a computer. The children are encouraged to work individually or in small groups, to make their own decisions and to locate and use informatom from a variety of sources.
